dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1019485771 at Tue Feb  9 23:21:02 UTC 2021

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: mailroom Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: mailroom Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.title: emailsProcessed SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: emailsProcessed SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors incoming emails delivered from the imap inbox and processed through Sidekiq's `email_receiver` queue.
Note that since Mailroom has poor observability, we use Sidekiq metrics for this, and this could lead to certain Sidekiq problems
being attributed to Mailroom
panels.title: Details

panels.description: Network utilization
panels.title: mailroom Deployment: Network IO

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="disk_inodes"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="mailroom", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description: Number of unread messages
panels.title: Unread Emails

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="mailroom", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or

or

or

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="mailroom", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="mailroom", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or

or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_jvm_heap_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_jvm_heap_memory", severity="s4"})

absent(fake_dne{component="rails_db_connection_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_rails_db_connection_pool", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_clients", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_clients", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_memory", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_primary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_primary_cpu", severity="s1"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_secondary_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_secondary_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="ruby_thread_contention", alert_dashboard="sat_ruby_thread_contention", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="shard_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_shard_cpu", severity="s3"})
or

)

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="mailroom", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="mailroom", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="mailroom",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

graph TD
  subgraph db
  patroni
  pgbouncer
end

  mailroom
end
